intro: Verbascum herzogii, commonly known as the Herzog's mullein, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers in clusters at the top of the stems, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Verbascum herzogii is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
